channel.title: Working Out
channel.description:
I'm 13, I am about 5'9 (5 feet 9 inches) in height, I do taekwondo, basketball, soccer, and other sports; and I want to build my muscles a bit more.
Should I do some weight lifting?
Why or Why not?

item.title: Working Out
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

Cole1497:

I really need to start working out. I keep telling myself, “next Friday, I’m going to be on the elliptical all day!” and then I will go on it for 10 minutes, and then go to a friends house, and continue eating garbage.

I have an elliptical, and all I can say is that it sucks. It gets horribly boring 5 minutes into it, and I find that I actually get much better results from walking/jogging. I am currently out of shape, so I don’t lift much, but I try to do 4-5 sets of curls every other night, occasional bench pressing, and I try to do leg lifting (I also have a universal gym), ab work (situps with one of those weighted medicine balls), and other workouts on the other nights. I also try to do a 1-2 mile walk/jog every night.

I’m 15 btw.

Read full topic

item.title: Working Out
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

Phaze One:

You are 13, so no. Trust me once you hit 14-15 you will naturally develop muscles. Weight lifting does stunt your growth and at your age so just wait it out. Your best bet is running and swimming to develop muscles

Thanks, this helped a lot too.

Read full topic

item.title: Working Out
item.dc:creator: @Kaex Kaex
item.description:
@Kaex wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:1, topic:385732”]I’m 13, I am about 5’9 (5 feet 9 inches) in height, I do taekwondo, basketball, soccer, and other sports; and I want to build my muscles a bit more.

Should I do some weight lifting?

Why or Why not?[/quote]

Your not old enough, your muscles are growing on there own, wait till your 15-16+ then probably buy 1.2kg dumbbells, a 3.5kg liftbar. And gradually build up in 8’s so 1.2 - 2 - 2.8 etc. 8 Every 4 months, 1 hour a night.

Read full topic

item.title: Working Out
item.dc:creator: @Saphire1 Saphire`
item.description:
@Saphire1 wrote:

[quote=“Clawz fury, post:1, topic:385732”]I’m 13, I am about 5’9 (5 feet 9 inches) in height, I do taekwondo, basketball, soccer, and other sports; and I want to build my muscles a bit more.

Should I do some weight lifting?

Why or Why not?[/quote]

Steroids!

Na, I use illegal protein and eat foods with high calories.

I intend to keep my body in a good shape, weight lifting will improve your muscles a lot if you keep at it maybe 3 - 4 times a week and try and hit a target of how many hours you want to do. Give your body time to heal so start off with one hour sessions in the gym. I can give you a lot more tips if you like, I have a strict diet myself which I’m happy to share with you.

I started off 6"1 weighing 10 stone, I’m not 14 stone muscle and this is only concentrating on my top half of body as my legs seem pretty strong from when I use to street dance.

Read full topic

item.title: Working Out
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

[quote=“casey., post:2, topic:385733”]Yeah, why not.

I wouldn’t do things as seriously at your age now, I would wait a year or two before picking up intensity, but I myself work out everyday.

You have to create a cycle to stick with.
So example:
Monday: upper body(bench) cardio
Tuesday: Lower(squat)
Weds: upper(bench)
Thurs: Power cleans and squat
Friday: Bench, Squat.
SAT-Cardio
Sunday-Rest

Now I do multiple workouts on these day as well…
For example: Monday
Bench
Closegrip
Dung bell work outs
Push press
Hammer press
ABS

I don’t take supplements. I always eat high protein meals after workout(chicken, potatoes, carrots)[/quote]
This really helped; thanks case.

OMFG Y DUN U HAVE THE IRC LEGEND STATUS ANYMORE! AND Y AM I HEREING U GOT BANNED?

WAT IS MOPARSCAPE COMING 2???@?#?@#?@?!?

FIRST KRACKY, NOW CASEY?

Read full topic

item.title: Working Out
item.dc:creator: @Syfal Syfal
item.description:
@Syfal wrote:

Benching is good. It builds up your pecs, which always looks good, and also adds more to your body shape (the V for guys, and the hourglass for girls). Also, do some curling to make your biceps larger.

Make sure that you lift all the parts of your body eventually, otherwise you have a decent chance of getting injured. It will take a while, but it’s likely.

Read full topic

item.title: Working Out
item.dc:creator: @the_wanderer The Wanderer
item.description:
@the_wanderer wrote:

I started weightlifting for football at 15 and at the end of my first year I’ve gone up about 40 pounds just going 3 times a week since around Christmas. We did weightlifting before that and I benched like 85 for my reps. Now I do 135 for say 4 sets of 6 reps. Maxed out at 155 For soccer I would do a lot of back squatting to build your thighs.

Read full topic

Also, I heard lifting too much weights stuns your growth, and I really don’t want a small dick.

Meh, your fine. If you start when you’re 10, that’s bad, but starting at 13 is fine. I have a friend who started when he was 13 and can now bench like 230
[/quote]
So there’s hope for me[/quote]
